tournament.name: South America Regional Championship 2025 - Devir Brasil

decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with various taxing effects. It also utilizes powerful removal spells and card advantage engines to maintain board control and outpace the opponent. The deck aims to apply pressure early and capitalize on the tempo advantage by disrupting the opponent's plays, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of aggressive threats and disruptive elements.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and utilizing burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature curve, while also using spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and finish off the opponent. With cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury leading the charge, this deck aims to close out games quickly and decisively. Additionally, cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison provide disruption and give the deck an edge against certain strategies.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, backed up by powerful support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer. The deck aims to control the battlefield with removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with fast lands like Arid Mesa and Windswept Heath, while also providing access to powerful utility lands like Arena of Glory and Elegant Parlor.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Birthing Ritual card to quickly ramp up mana and play powerful creatures with flash and disruptive abilities. It includes a mix of creatures with flash such as Ice-Fang Coatl and Shardless Agent, along with counter spells like Flare of Denial and Sink into Stupor to control the game. The deck also features powerful cards like Subtlety and Endurance to disrupt opponent's strategies. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish board control and pressure the opponent with its efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck focuses on using artifacts to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The main strategy is to utilize cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to generate mana and card advantage, while creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Memnite provide a fast clock for the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Lavaspur Boots and Shadowspear offer additional ways to push damage through and close out the game. The deck aims to quickly deploy threats and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure a victory.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Broodscale Bloodchief and other creatures like Basking Broodscale and Glaring Fleshraker to generate a powerful combo. The deck also includes cards like Emrakul, the Promised End and Walking Ballista for additional threats. The key strategy is to use cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble to control the board while setting up the combo. The deck also includes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Urza's Saga to search for key pieces. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful combo and control elements.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays while disrupting the opponent with various tax effects and removal spells. It aims to put pressure on the opponent with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while also utilizing powerful cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Quantum Riddler. Consign to Memory and Teferi, Time Raveler help control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells such as Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt, along with some protection and card advantage options like Solitude and Ephemerate.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. It also has cards that can flicker creatures like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to generate additional value. Utilizing the Death and Taxes archetype, it aims to control the opponent's resources while applying pressure on the board. With a mix of removal, disruption, and efficient creatures, the deck looks to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through tempo advantage.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, aiming to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan and Territorial Kavu along with powerful enchantments like Leyline of the Guildpact, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to be fast and unpredictable, keeping the opponent on their toes and putting pressure on them from the very beginning.

This deck focuses on quickly playing out artifact creatures and artifacts to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By using cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble for mana acceleration and card draw, the deck can quickly establish a strong board presence. Cards like Metallic Rebuke and Sink into Stupor provide disruption and control elements to help retain tempo. The inclusion of Emry, Lurker of the Loch allows for recursion of artifacts from the graveyard, while Urza's Saga provides additional artifact creatures and artifacts to further enhance the aggro strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Teferi, Time Raveler, you can disrupt your opponent's strategy while also benefiting from cards like Solitude and Flickerwisp to control the board. Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd provide strong aggro threats, while Quantum Riddler and Witch Enchanter help with card advantage and synergies. The deck aims to outvalue and out-tempo opponents in order to secure a win.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures that disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly closing out the game. By utilizing powerful creatures like Phelia and Phlage, along with cards like Solitude and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, this deck aims to control the board and deal damage efficiently. Additionally, with cards like Consign to Memory and Lightning Bolt for removal and disruption, supported by Teferi, Time Raveler for additional control, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy, ultimately leading to victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly outpace your opponent with aggressive creatures while disrupting their game plan with tax effects. The deck aims to control the board through removal spells and powerful creatures like Phlage and Elesh Norn, while also utilizing cards like Quantum Riddler and Teferi, Time Raveler to slow down and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes versatile cards like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory to deal with a variety of threats. Overall, this deck focuses on aggressive plays and disruption to secure victory.

This deck aims to put pressure on the opponent's resources by disrupting their game plan with disruptive creatures and removal spells, while also using aggressive threats to quickly close out the game. The combination of disruptive creatures like Phelia and Quantum Riddler, along with efficient removal spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending, allows the deck to control the board while pushing through damage. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection for your creatures, while cards like Consign to Memory and Ephemerate offer card advantage and versatility. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan by providing all the necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with low-cost artifact creatures like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary, supported by powerful artifact cards like Mox Opal and Engineered Explosives. It utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Urza's Saga to generate card advantage and create threats. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Metallic Rebuke to control the game. By efficiently deploying artifacts and utilizing synergy with Urza's Saga, the deck aims to apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of quick, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Dragon's Rage Channeler, along with plenty of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart. This deck aims to apply constant pressure and deal direct damage to your opponent as quickly as possible, utilizing cards like Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge to pump up your creatures and finish off your opponent efficiently. The inclusion of card draw and scry effects like Expressive Iteration and Preordain help ensure consistent draws and sustained aggression.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana using ramp cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cast Primeval Titan and combo off with cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble. The key strategy is to manipulate lands and play Urza's Saga to search for key artifacts to help assemble the combo. The deck also includes toolbox cards like Green Sun's Zenith to search for specific creatures and answer threats. The land base is crucial in ensuring the deck can produce the necessary colors and mana to execute the combo efficiently.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells. It aims to maintain a fast-paced tempo, utilizing powerful creatures like Ajani and Ragavan to apply pressure early on. The deck also incorporates removal spells like Solitude and Galvanic Discharge to control the board and protect its threats. With a mix of aggressive creatures, burn spells, and removal, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Thraben Charm adds disruption to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing the Boros colors to quickly deal damage and control the board. The deck includes powerful creatures like Ragavan and Phlage, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off opponents. The inclusion of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provides additional synergy and utility. By combining aggressive creatures with efficient removal and burn spells, this deck aims to establish board presence and quickly close out games.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Fatal Push, Prismatic Ending, and Force of Negation to control the board, you can create openings for your creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to deal damage quickly. Teferi, Time Raveler and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional disruption and card advantage. Ephemerate and Solitude offer protection and removal options, while Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog provide card draw and filtering. The mana base is designed to support a variety of colors for flexibility in casting your spells.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It looks to disrupt the opponent with control elements such as Force of Negation and Thoughtseize while also providing card advantage with Faithful Mending. The key strategy is to set up a combo involving Atraxa, Grand Unifier, Quantum Riddler, and Psychic Frog to control the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's diverse color requirements for its spells.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes cards like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Consign to Memory to control the board and gain advantage. Quantum Riddler and Teferi, Time Raveler help in slowing down the opponent and disrupting their plays. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats efficiently. The goal is to keep the opponent on the back foot while steadily building up your own board presence to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent by efficiently deploying threats that disrupt their game plan. It utilizes cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Quantum Riddler to quickly close out games, while also making use of disruptive spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending to control the board. The deck also includes elements of flicker and card advantage with cards like Ephemerate and Consign to Memory. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and protection for the deck's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and come out ahead in combat. It aims to pressure the opponent with early threats like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, while disrupting their gameplay with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory. The deck also includes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the strategy is to apply pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and control the board to come out victorious.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a board full of artifacts, taking advantage of their synergy with cards like Arcbound Ravager and Urza's Saga. By casting cheap spells and utilizing efficient mana sources like Mox Opal, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The inclusion of Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt provides additional ways to control the board and disrupt opposing strategies. Overall, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and outpace the opponent in order to secure a victory.

The main focus of this Aggro-Affinity deck is to quickly deploy a wide array of artifact creatures and utilize cards like Arcbound Ravager and Urza's Saga to generate explosive board presence and overpower opponents. The deck also includes various artifacts and spells to disrupt opponent's strategies, such as Engineered Explosives, Tormod's Crypt, and Metallic Rebuke. The inclusion of Mishra's Bauble and Thoughtcast helps maintain card advantage and ensure a consistent flow of threats. The overall strategy centers around leveraging the synergy between artifacts and aggressive creatures to overwhelm opponents and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly playing out multiple artifacts and using them to generate a strong board presence, often overwhelming opponents with quick and efficient creatures. By combining powerful artifact creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary with cheap artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal, the deck aims to control the board and deal damage before the opponent can recover. With the right combination of artifacts and efficient spells like Metallic Rebuke and Thoughtcast, the deck can quickly establish dominance and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to react.

This aggressive Rakdos deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong offensive presence. With a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Ragavan and Sorin, the deck looks to quickly close out games before the opponent can stabilize. Blood Moon can also punish greedy mana bases, while Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides additional reach in the late game. Overall, the deck prioritizes efficient threats and disruption to overwhelm opponents and secure victories in the Modern format.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly through cards like Ruby Medallion and rituals, while using Ral, Monsoon Mage to generate extra spells and damage. The goal is to cast spells efficiently and build towards a big finish with a storm count leading to a lethal Grapeshot. The deck also utilizes cards like Valakut Awakening and Past in Flames to refill the hand and keep the combo going. The inclusion of Wish allows for additional flexibility in finding key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a massive storm turn.

The main concept of this Modern UR Aggro deck is to quickly and aggressively play creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear, supporting them with spells like Lightning Bolt and Mutagenic Growth to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. The deck also includes card draw and selection with Expressive Iteration and Preordain to maintain resources and keep up the pressure. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle with fetch lands and dual lands for consistent mana access.

The main idea of the deck is to control the game by utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures and the Urza lands to generate a lot of mana quickly. The deck includes a mix of removal spells, card draw, and powerful planeswalkers like Karn and Ugin to maintain board control and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By assembling the UrzaTron lands and casting big threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths, the deck aims to dominate the late game and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful Eldrazi creatures and utilizing the Tron lands to ramp up mana quickly. Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator are key cards for disrupting opponents, while Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths provide strong threats. The deck aims to stall the game and outvalue opponents by casting high-impact spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. By assembling UrzaTron and efficiently using mana, this control deck aims to dominate the late game and secure victory.
